title: Genomics001: Parabricks-Genomics-nf pipeline parameters
description: GPU-enabled mapping and short variant calling with Parabricks

input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

input.description: Path to comma-separated file containing information about the samples in the experiment.
input.help_text: A sample sheet with all metadata for the cohort you are processing. This file must be **comma-separated** and contain a header and one row per sample. Columns should correspond to `sample`,`fq1`,`fq2`,`platform`,`library`,`center`. See usage docs.

outdir.description: The output directory where the results will be saved. You have to use absolute paths to storage on Cloud infrastructure.

ref.help_text: A reference genome FASTA file. Species with a public reference genome can be downloaded from [Ensembl](https://asia.ensembl.org/info/data/ftp/index.html), [UCSC](https://genome.ucsc.edu/goldenPath/help/ftp.html), or [NCBI](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/genome/doc/ftpfaq/) ftp sites.

cohort_name.description: Name of prefix for the joint called VCF file.

nci_gadi_configuration.title: NCI Gadi configuration
nci_gadi_configuration.description: Provide if running this pipeline on NCI Gadi, ignore otherwise.

gadi_account.description: The NCI project code for accounting and storage.

storage_account.description: An NCI project code for storage, in addition to the `gadi_account`

annotation.title: Annotation
annotation.description: Define variant effect predictor (VEP) cache settings

download_vep_cache.help_text: For available species caches, please see the [VEP download site](https://ftp.ensembl.org/pub/release-111/variation/vep/) to determine which species and assembly you need to specify.
